questions.q: Fundamental Duties were added to the Indian Constitution by which Constitutional Amendment?
questions.rationale: Fundamental Duties were added via the 42nd Amendment in 1976[cite: 19, 20, 21, 22].

questions.q: Which Fundamental Duty was added later by the 86th Constitutional Amendment Act, 2002?
options: To provide opportunities for education to children between 6-14 years by parents/guardians
To protect and improve the natural environment
questions.rationale: The 11th duty regarding education for children aged 6-14 was added by the 86th Amendment[cite: 26, 29, 31, 35].

questions.q: UP presented its first Economic Survey in which year?
questions.rationale: The document identifies the 2025-26 survey as a key milestone for Uttar Pradesh[cite: 45, 46, 49].

questions.q: India-Netherlands Hydrogen Fellowship launched on?
questions.rationale: The fellowship was launched on 10 February 2026[cite: 55, 56, 58].

questions.q: Which of the following statements about SATYA Portal is correct?
options: SATYA is related to automation of STQC lab services
It was launched under the Ministry of Science and Technology
questions.rationale: SATYA relates to STQC lab automation; Statement 2 is incorrect based on the provided material[cite: 62, 63, 67, 71].

questions.q: India's rank in the Network Readiness Index 2025 is:
questions.rationale: India's 2025 rank is highlighted in the Network Readiness Index[cite: 77, 78].

questions.q: Santosh Trophy is related to which sport?
questions.rationale: The Santosh Trophy is a prestigious Indian football tournament[cite: 83, 85, 87, 90].

questions.q: Which statements about World Pulses Day are correct?
options: It is observed every year on 10 February
It was declared by FAO in 2016
questions.rationale: World Pulses Day is Feb 10, declared by FAO in 2016 to promote sustainable farming[cite: 96, 97, 98, 99, 101, 102, 103, 104].

questions.q: Gujarat signed the digital connectivity LoI with which entity?
questions.rationale: Gujarat signed the LoI with Starlink for digital connectivity[cite: 108, 109, 110].

questions.q: Which statements about Chandrayaan-4 are correct?
options: It is India's first lunar sample-return mission
The landing region is Mons Mouton
questions.rationale: Chandrayaan-4 is a sample-return mission targeting the Mons Mouton region[cite: 116, 117, 118, 119, 120, 123].

questions.q: Regarding the India-Greece Defence Pact 2026, which statements are correct?
options: Includes a Joint Declaration to boost industrial cooperation
Aligns Aatmanirbhar Bharat with Greece's Agenda 2030
Greece will place a liaison officer at IFC-IOR
questions.rationale: The pact focuses on broad cooperation, not just naval exercises[cite: 126, 127, 130, 131, 133, 134, 137, 138, 142].

questions.q: RBI approved the appointment of R. Vijay Anand as MD & CEO of:
questions.rationale: R. Vijay Anand was appointed to City Union Bank[cite: 146, 147, 150].

questions.q: What is the total outlay of the UP Budget 2026-27?
questions.rationale: The total outlay announced is ₹9.13 lakh crore[cite: 244, 246, 256, 813, 815, 821].

questions.q: Which country topped the Corruption Perceptions Index (CPI) 2025?
questions.rationale: Denmark topped the 2025 index with a score of 89[cite: 291, 294, 298, 332, 336, 826, 829, 834].

questions.q: Which country topped the Women, Peace and Security (WPS) Index 2025/26?
questions.rationale: Denmark is the top-ranked country on the WPS index[cite: 343, 344, 346, 381, 385, 839, 841, 845].

questions.q: According to the UBS Billionaire Ambitions Report 2025, which country has the highest number of billionaires?
questions.rationale: The US leads with 924 billionaires[cite: 390, 392, 394, 399, 415, 420, 848, 850, 856].

questions.q: Aditya Pandya became India's youngest male analog astronaut after completing a mission in:
questions.rationale: The mission was conducted at Dholavira, Kutch[cite: 437, 441, 443, 445, 457, 462, 861, 864, 868].

questions.q: Who composed Vande Mataram?
questions.rationale: Bankim Chandra Chattopadhyay is the composer[cite: 492, 494, 504, 506, 873, 876].

questions.q: The new proposed base year for India's GDP and IIP is:
questions.rationale: MOSPI proposed 2022-23 as the base year[cite: 557, 558, 577, 587, 881, 882, 885].

questions.q: Removal of the Lok Sabha Speaker is under which Article?
questions.rationale: Article 94(c) covers the removal of the Speaker[cite: 590, 591, 604, 613, 889, 890].

questions.q: Under amended IT Rules 2021, unlawful content must be removed within:
questions.rationale: The removal window was reduced to 3 hours[cite: 627, 628, 633, 637, 642, 650, 652, 895, 896, 900, 905].

questions.q: Lyriothemis keralensis belongs to which order?
questions.rationale: This dragonfly species belongs to the order Odonata[cite: 665, 666, 668, 669, 680, 685, 909, 910, 912, 913].

questions.q: The French Revolution began in which year?
questions.rationale: The French Revolution started in 1789[cite: 702, 703, 705].

questions.q: The slogan 'Liberty, Equality, Fraternity' is related to:
questions.rationale: This motto is the hallmark of the French Revolution[cite: 722, 725, 729, 731].

questions.q: Fundamental Duties are mentioned in which Article of the Constitution?
questions.rationale: Fundamental Duties are listed in Article 51A[cite: 926, 930, 933, 936].

questions.q: What is the specific duration set for singing all 6 stanzas of Vande Mataram according to the new MHA directive?
questions.rationale: The directive specifies that singing all 6 stanzas takes approximately 3 minutes and 10 seconds[cite: 533, 542].

questions.q: Which technology is cited as the 'Key Technology' used in Aditya Pandya's analog astronaut mission?
questions.rationale: The mission utilized a 'Digital Twin system' for the lunar habitat simulation[cite: 468, 470].

questions.q: What is the specific GSDP growth rate estimated for Uttar Pradesh in the 2026-27 budget?
questions.rationale: The UP budget estimates a GSDP growth rate of 13.4%.

questions.q: Under the new IT Rules 2021, what is the removal timeline for 'non-consensual' (without consent) content?
questions.rationale: While general unlawful content has a 3-hour window, non-consensual content must be removed within 2 hours[cite: 650, 652].

questions.q: In the Corruption Perceptions Index 2025, which countries shared the lowest score of 9?
questions.rationale: South Sudan and Somalia recorded the lowest scores of 9 in the 2025 index[cite: 335, 339].

questions.q: What is the new proposed base year for the Consumer Price Index (CPI) specifically?
questions.rationale: While GDP and IIP use 2022-23, the CPI base year is proposed as 2024[cite: 578, 586].

questions.q: Maharishi Dayanand Saraswati, whose birth anniversary is celebrated on February 12, was the founder of which reform movement?
questions.rationale: Maharishi Dayanand Saraswati founded the Arya Samaj in 1875 in Bombay to revive Vedic knowledge and social reform.

questions.q: Which of the following slogans was given by Swami Dayanand Saraswati?
questions.rationale: His famous call 'Go back to the Vedas' (Vedas ki aur lauto) emphasized the Vedas as the ultimate source of truth.

questions.q: What was the original name of Maharishi Dayanand Saraswati?
questions.rationale: He was born as Mool Shankar Tiwari in Tankara, Gujarat, on February 12, 1824.

questions.q: Which famous book, explaining Vedic principles and critiquing social evils, was authored by Dayanand Saraswati?
questions.rationale: 'Satyarth Prakash' (The Light of Truth), published in 1875, is his most influential literary work.

questions.q: The 200th Birth Anniversary (Jayanti) of Maharishi Dayanand Saraswati is being commemorated during which period?
questions.rationale: The Government of India is celebrating his 200th Jayanti from 2024 to 2026, which included the release of a ₹200 commemorative coin.

questions.q: Nana Fadnavis, born on February 12, 1742, was a prominent statesman of which empire?
questions.rationale: Nana Fadnavis was an influential minister and diplomat in the Maratha Empire, often called the 'Maratha Machiavelli'.

questions.q: On February 12, 1922, Mahatma Gandhi announced the withdrawal of which major movement?
questions.rationale: Following the Chauri Chaura incident, Gandhiji withdrew the Non-Cooperation Movement on February 12, 1922, during the Bardoli Congress Working Committee meeting.

questions.q: Hakim Ajmal Khan, whose legacy is celebrated in the context of Indian medicine and independence, was a founder of which university?
questions.rationale: Hakim Ajmal Khan, born in February, was a key founder of Jamia Millia Islamia and a pioneer in Unani medicine.
